trans-unit.source: The DEGREES function converts a specified number from radians to degrees.

seg-source.mrk: The DEGREES function converts a specified number from radians to degrees.

target.mrk: The DEGREES function converts a specified number from radians to degrees.

trans-unit.source: The specified number is an angle measured in radians, which is converted to an approximately equivalent angle measured in degrees. The specified number must be a <xref href="rrefsqljdoubleprecision.dita#rrefsqljdoubleprecision">DOUBLE PRECISION</xref> number.

seg-source.mrk: The specified number is an angle measured in radians, which is converted to an approximately equivalent angle measured in degrees.
The specified number must be a <xref href="rrefsqljdoubleprecision.dita#rrefsqljdoubleprecision">DOUBLE PRECISION</xref> number.

target.mrk: The specified number is an angle measured in radians, which is converted to an approximately equivalent angle measured in degrees.
The specified number must be a <xref href="rrefsqljdoubleprecision.dita#rrefsqljdoubleprecision">DOUBLE PRECISION</xref> number.

trans-unit.source: The conversion from radians to degrees is not exact. You should not expect DEGREES(ACOS(0.5)) to return exactly 60.0.

seg-source.mrk: The conversion from radians to degrees is not exact.
You should not expect DEGREES(ACOS(0.5)) to return exactly 60.0.

target.mrk: The conversion from radians to degrees is not exact.
You should not expect DEGREES(ACOS(0.5)) to return exactly 60.0.

trans-unit.source: The data type of the returned value is a DOUBLE PRECISION number.

seg-source.mrk: The data type of the returned value is a DOUBLE PRECISION number.

target.mrk: The data type of the returned value is a DOUBLE PRECISION number.
